Container.Name: Seafile
Container.Overview:
This is an unofficial template that uses the official seafile community docker image.
Seafile is an open source file sync&share solution designed for high reliability, performance and productivity. Sync, share and collaborate across devices and teams. Build your team's knowledge base with Seafile's built-in Wiki feature.
Container.Requires:
Requirements: - MariaDB or another compatible SQL server
Recommended but optional:
- memcached - A reverse proxy like Nginx-Proxy-Manager

Config.Name: Seafile Hostname
Config.Description: IP or hostname for this Seafile server. Examples: 192.168.1.64, seafile.mydomain.com

Config.Name: SQL Host
Config.Description: IP or hostname to the SQL server including the port if it's not 3306. Examples: 192.168.1.64:4444, 192.168.1.1, seafile-mariadb.

Config.Name: Admin Email
Config.Description: Specifies Seafile admin user, default is 'me@example.com'.

Config.Name: Admin Password
Config.Description: Specifies Seafile admin password, default is 'asecret'.

Config.Name: Data Path
Config.Description: This is where all your hosted files, logs and seafile configurations will be stored.

Config.Name: SSL/TLS Port
Config.Description: Recommended to leave blank. Specify a port only if you intend to use SSL/TLS without a reverse proxy. Reverse proxy is recommended.

Config.Name: Create a Let's Encrypt Certificate
Config.Description: Seafile will request and install a SSL-Certificate by itself based on the Seafile hostanme. Only viable with SSL/TLS Port. Domain needed. Do not use when using a reverse proxy (recommended).
